SEARCH
Package civitas.celestis.graphics.geometry

Class Vertex

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Number
civitas.celestis.math.vector.Vector3
civitas.celestis.graphics.geometry.Vertex
All Implemented Interfaces:
Numeric, DoubleVector<Vector3>, Vector<Vector3>, Serializable, Comparable<Vector3>
public class Vertex extends Vector3
A point within a 3D coordinate system. The coordinates are represented as double in the notation X, Y, and Z.

The X, Y, Z axes represent width, height, depth respectively. Positive X faces the right, positive Y faces upwards, and positive Z faces forwards.

Due to Vertex inheriting Vector3, all arithmetic operations can be performed with a vector as the input parameter. Thus, other subclasses of Vector3 are also compatible with a vertex. Vertices are mainly used in a graphical context.

Unlike its parent class, Vertex does not allow the use of non-finite values. Non-finite values include Double.NaN, Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY, and Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY.

See Also:
